article.headline: Hartford 80, S. Carolina St. 72
article.story: LAS VEGAS (AP) -- Jaret Von Rosenberg scored a career-high 31 points, including a game-tying 3-pointer with 14 seconds left in regulation, to lead Hartford to an 80-72 victory over South Carolina State on Saturday in the fifth-place game of the Las Vegas Invitational. Von Rosenberg shot 9-for-14 -- including 6-for-9 from 3-point range -- made all seven of his free throws and had nine points in overtime. Hartford rallied from a 65-58 deficit with 2:14 left in regulation. In overtime, the Hawks scored the first six points and never trailed. Joe Zeglinski had 11 points and five rebounds for Hartford (3-4), and Warren McLendon had 10 points and five rebounds. Jason Flagler led South Carolina State (1-5) with 15 points and eight rebounds. Julius Carter added 12 points. The Bulldogs' Carrio Bennett missed a potential game-winning shot in the lane in the final shot of regulation. The Bulldogs, who out-rebounded the Hawks 53-33, built a 44-36 lead in the second half but the Hawks went on a 16-4 run to take a 52-48 lead with 9:58 remaining. Later, the Bulldogs retook the lead 57-56 with 6:01 left and pulled away for that seven-point lead with 2:14 left.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
